content.description: Problem passes along the base of the wall and upwards to the right.  It starts on big but awkward holds and moves up and to the right and into the orange streak.  It tops out at the same place as Burnt Loaf.  Top out is committing and hard.  Climb passes over several sharp boulders so a good spot is needed with a big pad to cover the rocks.
content.protection: A good spotter, a large pad.  You can set cams into a crack above the climb.
content.location: Far right end of Clown's Loaf before the crack of Burnt Loaf.

content.description: Starts just to the right of the second crack on the first large boulder facing the Clown's Loaf wall.  You move up the crack, eventually using it as an under-cling.  At this point, get your feet into the crack and toe-cam it and move up the wall using the combo of toe-cams and face holds.  Eventually leave the crack and pull up to the face and top it out.
content.protection: Good spotter, pad.  You can also stem the two, the boulder and the Clown's Loaf wall, if necessary. Finally, you could set up a top rope anchor using cams and slings placed above the route.
content.location: When you come to the Clown's Loaf Wall (above the Kingdom of Zilch).  Head East along the wall.  You will come to a large boulder about 15 feet tall.  The first crack is called Clown's Crack.  I Love Toe-Cams is the second crack on this boulder.

content.description: Right leaning crack.  Nice little warmup.  Good hand and fist jams.  Crux is at the top.
content.protection: None needed, though it could be protected with medium sized gear to practice trad on and anchors can be placed on top.
content.location: The first right leaning crack on the first boulder opposite to the Clown's Loaf.

content.description: Just right of the large orange streak of Loafing in the Bakery is the obvious crack that cuts diagonally up and to the left. Mantling is definitely the crux.
content.protection: Can set up an anchor if needed.  The crack extends upwards past the top. This crack takes small pro in order to build the anchor.  Bonus us you can use the same anchor for Loafing in the Bakery.
content.location: Far right side of the Clown's Loaf.  The obvious left leaning crack

content.description: Above the Kingdom of Zilch.  Shady most of the day.  Rock quality is good but not great.  Kind of off by itself eventhough it is next to the Kingdom of Zilch.
